intro: Polyosma rampae, commonly known as the mountain mistflower, is a rare and endemic plant found in the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers.
